summary: Warrenton refers to the CIA Record Center located in Warrenton, Virginia. In the context of the JFK assassination records, the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) discussed the release of records held at the Warrenton Records Center. The ARRB made decisions regarding the release of these CIA records, specifically addressing the Warrenton Records Center during their meetings. The documents indicate that the ARRB was actively involved in determining which records from the Warrenton Records Center would be made available to the public.
significance: The Warrenton Records Center is significant as a repository of CIA records related to the JFK assassination. The ARRB's decisions regarding the release of records from this center directly impact the availability of information pertaining to the assassination.
